numbered_ace_sentences: 1. This graph is a line graph.
2. The dots between the lines represent a parents' income rank.
3. The black line represents an average admissions rate for legacy applicants.
4. The gray line represents a general admissions rate for non-legacy applicants.
5. For legacy applicants, a higher parents' income rank increases the admissions rate.
6. For non-legacy applicants, a higher parents' income rank increases the admissions rate.
7. Rich legacy applicants have a higher admissions rate than other applicants.
8. The graph dips near the 90th parents' income rank.
9. I wonder why the graph dips near the 90th parents' income rank.
10. I wonder how race affects the admissions rate of these students.
11. I wonder how gender affects the admissions rate of these students.
12. I wonder how ethnicity affects the admissions rate of these students.
13. The message of the graph is that legacy applicants are generally more likely to be accepted into top colleges.
14. The message of the graph is that rich legacy applicants are especially likely to be accepted into top colleges.
15. The headline is: Cha-Ching!$ The big bucks help you get into college, as well as your fam (loved ones) who attended the college you want.
